1.text: Proclaim what is consistent with sound doctrine:

2.text: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober-minded, sound in faith, love and patience.

3.text: Likewise, older women should be reverent in behavior, not malicious gossips, nor enslaved to much wine, but teachers of what is good.

4.text: They should instruct the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

5.text: to be sober-minded, chaste, homemakers, [and to be] kind. Young women should be in subjection to their own husbands, so that God’s word may not be disgraced.

6.text: Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober-minded.

7.text: Be an example of good works in all things. In your teaching, be a model of integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,

8.text: and soundness of speech that is beyond reproach. This way, those who oppose you will be ashamed, having nothing bad to say about us.

9.text: Exhort slaves to be in subjection to their own masters and well-pleasing in all things, not argumentative,

10.text: not stealing, but [instead] trustworthy, so that they may make the doctrine of God our Savior attractive in every way.

11.text: Truly, the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all.

12.text: It has taught us that we should deny what is ungodly and worldly lusts, that we should live soberly, righteously, and in a godly way in this present world,

13.text: waiting for the blessed hope: the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ.

14.text: He gave himself for us in order to redeem us from all iniquity and to purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works.

15.text: Teach these things, exhort and reprove with complete authority. Let no one despise you!
